memberdef.name: NRF24L01_RX_PW_PIPE
memberdef.initializer: = { NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_RX_PW_P0, NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_RX_PW_P1, NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_RX_PW_P2, NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_RX_PW_P3, NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_RX_PW_P4, NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_RX_PW_P5, }

memberdef.name: NRF24L01_ADDR_REGS
memberdef.initializer: = { NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_RX_ADDR_P0, NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_RX_ADDR_P1, NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_RX_ADDR_P2, NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_RX_ADDR_P3, NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_RX_ADDR_P4, NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_RX_ADDR_P5, NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_TX_ADDR, }

detaileddescription.para: Reads a single byte from the provided register address. Interprets platform error codes into NRF24L01 internal error codes

parameterdescription.para: : The 8-bit SPI register address Valid addresses can be found here here
-> The data pointer is not valid

briefdescription.para: Checks if the nRF24L01(+) is present on the SPI bus.
Configures the RX payload size for a specific pipe.

detaileddescription.para: All pipes can be modified simultaneously using NRF24L01_ALL_RX_PIPES

parameterdescription.para: : The desired RX payload length (1 to 32 bytes)
: The desired power mode between PWR_UP and PWR_DOWN
: The desired operational mode between RX and TX

detaileddescription.para: IMPORTANT: The device will forcibly turn on the CRC in case auto acknowledgment is enabled for at least one RX pipe
The resultant frequency will be (2400 + channel)MHz
IMPORTANT: This method has the side effect of resetting the PLOS_CNT[7:4] bits in the OBSERVER_TX register

parameterdescription.para: : The desired radio frequency channel from 0 to 127

detaileddescription.para: Setting zero for arc means that automatic retransmission is completely disabled

parameterdescription.para: : The desired number of auto retransmits, from 0 to 15

briefdescription.para: Configures the common address width for all channels.

parameterdescription.para: : The desired address width from 3 to 5

memberdef.argsstring: (nrf24l01_pipe_t pipe, const uint8_t *addr, nrf24l01_address_width_t addr_width, nrf24l01_platform_t *platform)
memberdef.name: nrf24l01_set_address

briefdescription.para: Sets the static RX address for a specified pipe.

detaileddescription.para: For pipes[2..5] only thefirst byte of address will be written because these pipes share the same first four (most significant) address bytes

parameterdescription.para: : A pointer to a buffer containing the desired address

briefdescription.para: Configures the transmitter rf output power.
Enables or disables an RX pipe.

detaileddescription.para: All pipes can be modified simultaneously using NRF24L01_ALL_RX_PIPES

briefdescription.para: Configures the auto retransmit mode (a.k.a. enhanced ShockBurst) for the specified RX pipe.

detaileddescription.para: All pipes can be modified simultaneously using NRF24L01_ALL_RX_PIPES

briefdescription.para: Sets the DPL mode for a specific RX pipe.

detaileddescription.para: All pipes can be modified simultaneously using NRF24L01_ALL_RX_PIPES

briefdescription.para: Gets the value of the STATUS register.

detaileddescription.para: Value can be interpreted using NRF24L01_STATUS_REG_BIT_x definitions

parameterdescription.para: : A pointer to the status register value

detaileddescription.para: The RX data received interrupt is signaled by NRF24L01_STATUS_REG_BIT_RX_DR The Tx data sent interrupt is signaled by NRF24L01_STATUS_REG_BIT_TX_DS The maximum retries interrupt is signaled by NRF24L01_STATUS_REG_BIT_MAX_RT

parameterdescription.para: : A pointer to the state of the IRQ flags, will be a bitwise ORing of NRF24L01_STATUS_REG_BIT_x values

briefdescription.para: Enables/disables device interrupts. Completely replaces previous configuration.

detaileddescription.para: An RX data received interrupt can be enabled with NRF24L01_CONFIG_REG_BIT_MASK_RX_DR A Tx data sent interrupt can be enabled with NRF24L01_CONFIG_REG_BIT_MASK_TX_DS A maximum retries interrupt can be enabled with NRF24L01_CONFIG_REG_BIT_MASK_MAX_RT

parameterdescription.para: : The new IRQ configuration, should be a bitwise ORing of NRF24L01_CONFIG_REG_BIT_MASK_x values

briefdescription.para: Gets the status of the RX or TX FIFO.

parameterdescription.para: : Select either the RX or the TX FIFO
: A pointer where the FIFO status, on of data available, full, empty or error, will be stored

briefdescription.para: Gets the pipe number for the payload available in the RX FIFO.

parameterdescription.para: : A pointer where the pipe number or 0x07 if the RX FIFO is empty
: A pointer where the number of lost packets is stored The max value is 15, can be reset by a write to RF_CH register
: A pointer where the auto re-transmit counter is stored The max value is 15, resets when a new transmission starts

detaileddescription.para: this setting is common for all pipes

parameterdescription.para: - RX/TX address field width, value from 3 to 5

detaileddescription.para: The packet loss counter is the PLOS_CNT bits in the OBSERVER_TX register

briefdescription.para: Writes a TX payload to the FIFO and triggers a transmission.

parameterdescription.para: : Pointer to a buffer with the TX payload data, remember the TX FIFO is 32 bytes long
: Length of buffer to transmit (in bytes)
-> Pointer to data buffer is null or size of data packet is too large

briefdescription.para: Gets the configured RX dynamic payload width.

parameterdescription.para: : Pointer to a location where the DPL will be stored
-> Pointer to DLP width is null

briefdescription.para: Check for interrupt function pointer which should be called often by the user to ensure that radio events are triggered.
